document: FDS Chapter 1: Data science in a big data world

questions.question: What is data science primarily considered as?
options: An evolutionary extension of statistics dealing with massive data
A type of database management system
questions.answer: An evolutionary extension of statistics dealing with massive data

questions.question: What is big data?
options: A blanket term for data sets too large for traditional processing
Data that is more than 1 terabyte
questions.answer: A blanket term for data sets too large for traditional processing

questions.question: What are the three Vs that characterize big data?
questions.answer: Volume, Variety, Velocity

questions.question: What does Volume refer to in the three Vs?
options: How diverse different types of data are
questions.answer: How much data there is

questions.question: What does Variety refer to in the three Vs?
options: How diverse different types of data are
questions.answer: How diverse different types of data are

questions.question: What does Velocity refer to in the three Vs?
options: How diverse different types of data are
questions.answer: The speed of data generation

questions.question: Where are data science and big data used?
options: Almost everywhere in both commercial and noncommercial settings
questions.answer: Almost everywhere in both commercial and noncommercial settings

questions.question: What type of data depends on a data model and resides in fixed fields?
questions.answer: Structured data

questions.question: What is SQL primarily used for?
options: Managing and querying data in databases
questions.answer: Managing and querying data in databases

questions.question: What type of data is challenging to fit into a data model because content is context-specific?
questions.answer: Unstructured data

questions.question: What is a special type of unstructured data that requires knowledge of linguistics?
questions.answer: Natural language

questions.question: What is machine-generated data?
options: Information automatically created without human intervention
questions.answer: Information automatically created without human intervention

questions.question: What are examples of machine-generated data?
options: Email messages and social media posts
Web server logs and call detail records
questions.answer: Web server logs and call detail records

questions.question: What does graph-based data focus on?
options: The content of individual data points
The relationship or adjacency of objects
questions.answer: The relationship or adjacency of objects

questions.question: What data types pose specific challenges for object recognition?
questions.answer: Audio, image, and video

questions.question: What is streaming data characterized by?
options: Flowing into systems when events happen
questions.answer: Flowing into systems when events happen

questions.question: What are examples of streaming data?
options: What's trending on Twitter and live sporting events
questions.answer: What's trending on Twitter and live sporting events

questions.question: What is the best-known distributed file system?
questions.answer: Hadoop File System (HDFS)

questions.question: What is a key advantage of distributed file systems?
options: They are simpler than local file systems
They can store files larger than any single computer disk
They are always faster for all operations
questions.answer: They can store files larger than any single computer disk

questions.question: What happens with files in distributed file systems?
options: They get automatically replicated across multiple servers
They are always stored on a single server
questions.answer: They get automatically replicated across multiple servers

questions.question: What is an important aspect of working on distributed systems?
options: You move data to your program
You move your program to the data
You cannot run programs on distributed systems
questions.answer: You move your program to the data

questions.question: What do data integration frameworks do?
options: Move data from one source to another
questions.answer: Move data from one source to another

questions.question: What fields are used to extract insights from data?
options: Machine learning, statistics, and applied mathematics
questions.answer: Machine learning, statistics, and applied mathematics

questions.question: What does NoSQL stand for?
questions.answer: Not Only SQL

questions.question: What do NoSQL databases allow?
questions.answer: Virtually endless growth of data

questions.question: What can traditional RDBMS systems not handle well?
questions.answer: Streaming, graph, or unstructured data

questions.question: What is an example of machine learning success mentioned?
options: Creating an algorithm that learns to play video games
Solving all natural language processing problems
questions.answer: Creating an algorithm that learns to play video games

questions.question: What company bought DeepMind for AI development?
questions.answer: Google

questions.question: What is MLBAM's plan with video capture?
options: To increase video capture to 7TB per game for analytics
questions.answer: To increase video capture to 7TB per game for analytics

questions.question: What do graph structures use to represent data?
questions.answer: Nodes, edges, and properties

questions.question: What does the big data ecosystem consist of?
options: Technologies with similar goals and functionalities
questions.answer: Technologies with similar goals and functionalities
